data.question: What is the empirical formula of the compound synthesized?
What method was used for the theoretical calculations of all the compounds?
Is the 1,3-pda ligand effectively photoinert under UV light with wavelength Î» < 320 nm?
What is the role of 1,4-bpeb in the synthesis of the porous coordination polymer?
data.answer: 1,4-bpeb plays the role of a ligand as well as that of a guest.

data.question: Does the coordination polymer maintain its integrity throughout the photoreaction processes?
What is the purpose of using a high-pressure mercury lamp in the experiment?
data.answer: The high-pressure mercury lamp is used to provide UV light for inducing photoreactions.

data.question: Was a single-crystal-to-single-crystal (SCSC) transformation observed in the study?
What types of photochemical reactions were observed in the coordination polymer?
Can the photoreactivity of the guest 1,4-bpeb molecules be monitored by IR spectroscopy?
What was the outcome of irradiating the sample with UV LED light at 365 nm?
What happens to the 1,4-bpeb guest molecules upon UV irradiation?
Is the 1,3-pda ligand involved in photodimerization reactions?
What structural feature is crucial for the photoreactivity of the guest and ligand molecules?
data.answer: The disposition, conformation, and orientation of these molecules.

data.question: Did the study report the first instance of solid-state regioselective [2 + 2] polymerization in a coordination polymer?
What was the main finding regarding the interplay among the photocenters in the coordination polymer?
data.answer: A strong coupling and feedback mechanism among the photocenters was discovered.

data.question: What was the effect of UV irradiation on the crystal structure of the coordination polymer?
data.answer: Significant structural changes were observed with the guest 1,4-bpeb molecules in the channels.

data.question: Is the coordination polymer capable of adjusting itself to the dynamic environment caused by photochemical reactions?
What synthetic strategy does the work present for the preparation of high molecular weight molecules?
data.answer: Using an array of polydentate groups as ligands to coordinate to metal ions to form porous frameworks.

data.question: Was the progress of the polymerization monitored by single-crystal X-ray diffraction?
What does the study suggest about the flexibility of the coordination polymers?
data.answer: The coordination polymers are not rigid but capable of providing the necessary flexibility.
